InfoButton.name:
Exploring plant responses to aphid feeding using a full Arabidopsis microarray reveals a small number of genes with significantly altered expression.

Plant material from wild-type Arabidopsis thaliana plants of Columbia-0 ecotype was analyzed.

Plants were grown individually in soil at 20°C.

Plants grown under 16/8 hour light/dark conditions.

After complete growth of rosette, at principle growth stage 3.90 (3-4 weeks after planting), treatment plants were cultured with Myzus persicaere (apterous aphids) using clip cages.

Leaves were harvested 8 hours after infestation. Controls and infested treatments were paired according to rosette size and leaf number.

Three biological replicate were processed - the average of which is shown.

RNA was isolated an hybridized to the ATH1 GeneChip.

The data were normalized by GCOS normalization, TGT 100.

This study is part of the AtGenExpress project, funded by the NSF.

Results provided by the Pritchard Lab.

Couldridge, C. et al., 2007. Bulletin of Entomological Research 97
